alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Kobuk River, Noatak River, and Koyukuk River from Allakaket to Hughes. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Bankfull conditions and minor flooding of low-lying areas is possible along the Kobuk River, Noatak River, and the Koyukuk River from Allakaket to Hughes. As of Tuesday morning, water levels continue to rise in Allakaket. There is water over the road that crosses Stanley Slough and water is now covering low lying areas around the old runway. Water levels crested at Bettles Monday night and are expected to crest in Allakaket Tuesday night. Additional rainfall through Wednesday may cause smaller streams and rivers to rise again. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell the past 5 days over the Koyukuk Basin from the Dalton Highway Wes and over the Kobuk and Upper Noatak Basins. Runoff from this rainfall continues to move down the Kobuk, Noatak, and Koyukuk Rivers. Another half inch of rain is expected over this area through Wednesday night. More heavy rain coming late this week with the remains of Tropical Storm Damrey could cause further high water this weekend. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
